WorkItem.Description:
When I try to optimize my tanking stuff with ProtPaladin, I got strange result.
 
I put 1 condition that is "% Chance to be Crit" <= 0
 
The result is that :
%Chance to be crit = 0
Defense : 539 ( Defense Rating 685).
 
Or with this value of Defense Rating I'm criticable. 
We need 689 defense rating to be non criticable.
 
I attache my xml file for you to test. Just do an optimization.
WorkItem.Summary: [ProtPaladin] Optimization for non Crit is wrong

Comments.Message:
actually, well, what does a 100% chance to block + avoidance tell you ?
You fill the combat table with Block and avoidance, pushing crit off the table.

If you want 540 or more defense, optimize for that or use the stam/resilience shoulderenchant to become uncritable.

Block depends on Holy Shield, if you are stun, you can activate it and you can be crit with your definition.

I ask for %Crit chance to be < 0 not for Avoidnace + Block > 100%

Not the same, for me ProtPaladin fails in his optimization.

Getting back to the old good Tankadin.
So long as crit has been pushed off the combat table the condition of %Crit chance to be < 0 has been fulfilled.

Crit can be pushed off the table by avoidance as well. If you have enough block, dodge, and parry you will be uncrittable just the same as if you had enough defense.
If your ultimate goal is you absolutely HAVE to have defense 540 then set the condition for that.

On top of that, there is an option under Options->Abilities that lets you uncheck the option to assume the 30% block from Holy Shileld.

We added "Defense Skill" as an optimizable function for this very reason; for people who don't understand the attack table table and would rather blindly see "540 defense". Please understand that this is the case.
